practices.title: US Land Surveying Best Practices
practices.description: Guidelines for selecting and using CRS for land surveying in the United States

recommendations.text: Use State Plane Coordinate System (SPCS) for official land surveys
Specify datum version (NAD83 or NAD83(2011)) in all survey documentation
Use NAD83(2011) based SPCS zones for new surveys where available
Document the EPSG code explicitly, not just zone name
Use UTM zones for cross-state projects if SPCS zones are impractical

commonMistakes.problem: NAD27 to NAD83 shifts can be 10-100 meters
commonMistakes.solution: Transform NAD27 data using NADCON grids before use

commonMistakes.problem: Some states use US Survey Feet, others use International Feet or Meters
commonMistakes.solution: Always verify and document the linear unit for each SPCS zone

commonMistakes.problem: Data crossing SPCS zone boundaries has increased distortion
commonMistakes.solution: Use separate zones or UTM for cross-zone projects

practices.title: NAD27 to NAD83 Migration
practices.description: Best practices for migrating legacy NAD27 data to NAD83

recommendations.text: Use NADCON grids for NAD27 to NAD83 transformation
Document the transformation method and date for all converted data
Validate transformation results against known control points
Preserve original NAD27 coordinates in metadata when possible
Consider re-surveying critical points if transformation accuracy is insufficient

commonMistakes.problem: 3-parameter Helmert transformation ignores local distortions in NAD27
commonMistakes.solution: Always use NADCON grids which model local distortions

commonMistakes.mistake: Assuming uniform shift across large areas
commonMistakes.problem: NAD27 to NAD83 shifts vary significantly by location
commonMistakes.solution: Apply transformations point-by-point, not as a bulk shift

practices.title: Web Mapping in the United States
practices.description: Guidelines for CRS selection in US web mapping applications

recommendations.text: Use EPSG:3857 (Web Mercator) for tile-based web maps
Use EPSG:4326 (WGS84) for GeoJSON data exchange
Document that measurements in Web Mercator are not accurate
Transform to appropriate projection for any measurement calculations
Use Conus Albers (EPSG:5070) for US-focused static maps

commonMistakes.mistake: Calculating distances or areas in Web Mercator
commonMistakes.problem: Web Mercator distorts distances and areas significantly
commonMistakes.solution: Transform to UTM or State Plane for measurements
Always transform to EPSG:4326 before creating GeoJSON
